title: Texas Firm Recalls Pork Products Due To Misbranding and Undeclared Allergens
summary: WASHINGTON, December 27, 2014 HEB Meat Center, a San Antonio, Texas establishment, is recalling approximately 83,666 pounds of pork products due to misbranding and undeclared allergens, the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS) announced today. The products may contain peanuts, known...

establishment.name: HEB Meat Plant
establishment.address:
4710 N. Pan Am Expressway 
  San Antonio, TX 78218

impacted_products: Random weight vacuum-packed clear packages containing “Pork Chorizo.”
Random weight clear covered trays containing “HEB Mi Comida Chorizo Pork Chorizo.”
Random weight vacuum-packed clear packages containing “SEASONED MEXICAN STYLE PORK FOR CARNE AL PASTOR.”
